texts.value: Involved in the initial and rate-limiting step of peroxisomal beta-oxidation of straight-chain saturated and unsaturated very-long-chain fatty acids. Catalyzes the desaturation of fatty acyl-CoAs such as palmitoyl-CoA (hexadecanoyl-CoA) to 2-trans-enoyl-CoAs ((2E)-enoyl-CoAs) such as (2E)-hexadecenoyl-CoA, and donates electrons directly to molecular oxygen (O(2)), thereby producing hydrogen peroxide (H(2)O(2))
Shows highest activity against medium-chain fatty acyl-CoAs. Shows optimum activity with a chain length of 10 carbons (decanoyl-CoA) in vitro
Is active against a much broader range of substrates and shows activity towards long-chain acyl-CoAs
Lipid metabolism; peroxisomal fatty acid beta-oxidation
Homodimer. The enzyme contains three components A, B and C, the latter two being produced from the first by a proteolytic cleavage. Interacts with LONP2 (By similarity)
Expressed in Schwann cells (PubMed:32169171). Expressed (at protein level) in liver (PubMed:1400324)
Belongs to the acyl-CoA oxidase family

citation.title: Complete nucleotide sequence of cDNA and predicted amino acid sequence of rat acyl-CoA oxidase.

Substrate specificities of rat liver peroxisomal acyl-CoA oxidases: palmitoyl-CoA oxidase (inducible acyl-CoA oxidase), pristanoyl-CoA oxidase (non-inducible acyl-CoA oxidase), and trihydroxycoprostanoyl-CoA oxidase.
Functional expression of two forms of rat acyl-CoA oxidase and their substrate specificities.
Loss- or Gain-of-Function Mutations in ACOX1 Cause Axonal Loss via Different Mechanisms.
Three-dimensional structure of the flavoenzyme acyl-CoA oxidase-II from rat liver, the peroxisomal counterpart of mitochondrial acyl-CoA dehydrogenase.
